place.name: BETWS TIR IARLL
place.gazetteerText: BETTWS, a parish in Bridgend district, Glamorgan; on the river Ogmore, 5½ miles N of Bridgend r. station. Post Town, Bridgend. Acres, 5,086. Real property, £1,357. Pop., 371. Houses, 75. The property is divided among a few. Coal is worked. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Newcastle, in the diocese of Llandaff. The church is good. There is a Unitarian chapel. Dr. Price, the nonconformist divine, was a native. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
